org.jsfml.window.event

Class JoystickMoveEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jsfml.window.event.Event
      • org.jsfml.window.event.JoystickEvent
        • org.jsfml.window.event.JoystickMoveEvent

  • public final class JoystickMoveEvent
extends JoystickEvent
    Represents joystick or gamepad axis movement events.

    Objects of this class are created for events of type Event.Type.JOYSTICK_MOVED.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class org.jsfml.window.event.Event

        Event.Type

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Joystick.Axis joyAxis
      The joystick or gamepad axis that was moved.
      float position
      The position that the axis was moved to, ranging between -100 and 100.

        joystickId

    • Field Detail

      • joyAxis

        public final Joystick.Axis joyAxis
        The joystick or gamepad axis that was moved.

      • position

        public final float position
        The position that the axis was moved to, ranging between -100 and 100.

    • Constructor Detail

      • JoystickMoveEvent

        public JoystickMoveEvent(int type,
                 int joystickId,
                 int joyAxis,
                 float position)
        Constructs a new joystick axis event.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of the event. This must be a valid ordinal in the Event.Type enumeration.
        joystickId - the joystick ID.
        joyAxis - the joystick axis that was moved. This must be a valid ordinal in the Joystick.Axis enumeration.
        position - the position that the axis was moved to.

    • Method Detail

      • asJoystickMoveEvent

        public JoystickMoveEvent asJoystickMoveEvent()
        Description copied from class: Event
        Attempts to cast this event to a JoystickMoveEvent.
        Overrides:
        asJoystickMoveEvent in class Event
        Returns:
        the event cast to a JoystickButtonEvent if its type is Event.Type.JOYSTICK_MOVED, null otherwise.
